title: Anchorz Field
alternate_titles: アンカーズ・フィールド
description: A war was about to begin on a certain planet. However, the rule of war decided by the no-tenki inhabitants of this planet was to compete for positions with anchor machines. Players will use anchor machines to unify 6 continents and 46 countries ... This game is a camp game where you skip anchors and increase your position. If you return the anchor that you flew with the anchor machine to your position within 3 shots, that will become your territory. However, you have to quickly expand your position while watching the wind direction, terrain, and the movement of the enemy. A game with high puzzle characteristics that requires the ability and strategy to make full use of various anchor machines.

title: Armored Unit
description: A robot simulation game where you fight using the robot weapon "Armored Unit". You have to use radar to find and destroy invisible enemies. Two modes, "Story Mode" and "Duel Mode". In "Story Mode", the purpose is to prevent the completion of the enemy's final weapon by making full use of the mobile weapon armored unit. "Duel mode" is a mode to play against friends using a communication cable, and you can fight against friends using the units obtained or modified by the user in "Story mode".

title: Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu for WonderSwan
alternate_titles: 爆走デコトラ伝説 for WonderSwan
description: A racing game where you modify and power up your own truck. In the WS version, there is a "national conquest mode" that aims to be the best tracker in Japan while fighting trackers all over the country while remodeling the truck, and a "communication confrontation mode" that fights by betting each other's truck parts using a communication cable powered by. In addition, the "Otoko no Hanamichi Mode" that was in the PS version has been integrated into the "National Conquest Mode" to further enhance the RPG-like elements! In addition to the parts that can be bought at the shop, the collection is also enhanced by preparing rare parts that can only be obtained from a specific tracker. Now, a new Dekotra legend begins with WS!

title: Beatmania for WonderSwan
description: A game where you can easily enjoy the feeling of DJ. It's an interesting operation feeling, but it is made so that you can freely choose from three types of button arrangements according to the user's preference. However, if you don't feel like scratching with the shosen button, use the included special turntable controller. If you use an adapter with headphones (sold separately), you can hear even more powerful beats. For WS, 10 famous songs such as "SOUL", "FUNK", and "REGGAE" are collected in green.

title: Buffers Evolution
description: Buffers Evolution is an Action game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Card Captor Sakura: Sakura to Fushigi na Clow Card
description: Card Captor Sakura: Sakura to Fushigi na Clow Card is a Role-Playing game, developed by Sims and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Chaos Gear: Michibi Kareshi Mono
description: Chaos Gear: Michibi Kareshi Mono is a Strategy game, developed by Lay-Up and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Cho Aniki: Otoko no Tamafuda
description:
So far, shooting and fighting action has been the staple of the Cho Aniki series, but now it has advanced into the card battle game. A battle of muscle, protein and men, it will be waged in the WonderSwan. Bring the power to a maximum and discover love, sweat and muscle.

Returning to the music, is Mr. Koji Hayama, a man who has become legend for his original Cho Aniki score. It is time to use your brains and muscle !!

title: Chocobo no Fushigi NA Dungeon for Wonderswan
alternate_titles: チョコボの不思議なダンジョン for ワンダースワン | Chocobo's Mysterious Dungeon for WonderSwan
description: The popular character Chocobo is now available as software for handheld game consoles! That popular game "Chocobo's Mysterious Dungeon" is now available as WS-only software. Unpredictable game development, tense dungeons, item search, automatic dungeon generation function that changes every time you play, etc., do not spoil the fun of the original version. In addition, the powerful screen effects, huge enemy characters, and the best sound of handheld game consoles are all the features of WonderSwan. Now, in WonderSwan, it's an adventure with a cute chocobo!

title: Chou-Denki Card Battle: Youfu Makai - Kikuchi Shuugyou
alternate_titles: Youkai Makai | 妖符魔界
description: A game that reproduces the world of Hideyuki Kikuchi, a best-selling author who realistically depicts the fantasy world, in a card battle. Hideyuki Kikuchi's unique world view and story are reproduced on the game scenario, and you can enjoy the battle with a tense card battle game. Depending on the card the player has, the story itself will develop in various directions. Since it supports online battles, playing with friends will make it even more fun.

title: Clock Tower for WonderSwan
description:
Jennifer Simpson is a child from the fictional Granite Orphanage in Romsdalen, Norway. She and her friends, who are also orphans (Laura, Ann and Lotte) are adopted in September 1995 (the same month the game was released) by a wealthy recluse named Mr. Barrows, who lives in a mansion known as the "Clock Tower", named after its predominant feature.

WS version of "Clock Tower" that scared many players with SFC / PS. Since it is compatible with stereo headphones, you can use headphones to reproduce realistic sound effects and sounds! You can enjoy the horror of running on your spine and the sound of a horror movie anytime, anywhere. The memory of fear revives again ...

title: Crazy Climber
description: Come one, come all! Watch the death-defying feats of a human fly - Crazy Climber! Help him scale the world's tallest buildings while avoiding tumbling girders, a marauding bird, and the villainous Mad Doctor. Hurry up! The show's about to start!

title: D's Garage21 K?bo Game: Tane o maku tori
description: Tane o Makutori is a Puzzle game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Densha de Go!
description: Densha de Go! is a Simulation game, developed and published by Taito Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Densha de Go! 2
description: Densha de Go! 2 is a Simulation game, developed by Taito Corporation and published by CyberFront, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Digimon Adventure 02: Tag Tamers
alternate_titles: デジモンアドベンチャー02 タッグテイマーズ
description: A mysterious story about why Ken-kun, also known as Digimon Kaiser, has entered the evil path. In addition to the conventional evolution, it also supports "Armor Evolution" and "Jogres Evolution", and new Digimon have joined, and more than 220 bodies have appeared. Players must play with both Ryo and Ken in a tag team to capture the digital world that exists in parallel. If you use a dedicated connector, you can battle with the conventional "Digimon series". If you use Wonder Wave, you can also use Digimon raised in D-One mode of PS software "Pocket Digimon World". In addition, jogress and digital exchange battle communication can be performed with "New Digivice D-3".

title: Digimon Adventure: Anode Tamer
alternate_titles: デジモンアドベンチャー～アノードテイマー～
description: The second in the Digimon series is an RPG that gathers friends while adventuring in the world of Digimon. By combining the collected Digimon, you can generate a special move called "Variable". Find the strongest Digimon and learn various "Variable Techniques" to create your own strongest Digimon unit! With a communication battle function that allows you to exchange Digimon with your friends and play against them.

title: Digimon Adventure: Cathode Tamer
alternate_titles: デジモンアドベンチャー カソードテイマー
description: Another version of "Digimon Adventure Anode Tamer" released in December 1999. There are a total of 169 types of Digimon that appear in this cathode tamer. Seven of them are original Digimon that appear only with cathode tamers. In addition to this, the appearance rate of Digimon is different from that of Anode Tamer, and the first enemy Digimon and boss characters are also different. There are changes in story development, and even users who already have an anode tamer can enjoy it. Since many Sea Digimon appear in the Cathode Tamer, you can enjoy it mainly by training attack-type units.

title: Digital Monster Ver. WonderSwan
alternate_titles: Dejitaru Monsutā Bashon Wandāsuwan | デジタルモンスタ
description: Digital Monster Ver. WonderSwan is a Japanese handheld version of the original Tamagotchi-like Digimon pet for the WonderSwan. It includes all of the original Digimon from the five different pet devices. In this game the player can have up to five different Digimon with them at a time. It even has computer controlled opponents to battle with. The game has the ability to connect to another WonderSwan through a special link cable. It can also hook up to the original pets through a Digimon "dock N rock" connector that comes packaged with the game. Digital Monster Ver. S: Digimon Tamers did much the same thing, only on the Sega Saturn.

title: Digital Partner
alternate_titles: デジタルパートナー
description: Software that teaches words to Digimon while talking with them, and makes friends with them even more. Digimon fight using the words they remember, so the more words the player teaches, the stronger they become. The player can talk with two Digimon at the same time, and the Digimon can talk with each other, so the range of conversation is greatly expanded. There are 49 Digimon that appeared in the TV anime "Digimon Adventure" and 11 Digimon that are scheduled to appear in the new program "Digimon Adventure 02", for a total of 60 Digimon.

title: Dokodemo Hamster
description: Dokodemo Hamster is a Strategy game, developed and published by Bec, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Engacho! for Wonderswan
alternate_titles: Engacho!(えんがちょ!) for ワンダースワン
description: Game genre "stupid game". A puzzle game in which the character designed by "Uruma Rupi" of "Ugougo Luga" becomes drooling or covered with poop while aiming for clearing. It's a stupid, gloomy, and unpleasant game that makes players feel uncomfortable when they're done, creating an addiction that makes them want to see the screen being done. Besides, as a title song and voice actor, it is supervised by Brother Korn. Gross and cuteness are produced coolly (!?) By his hands.

title: Fever Sankyo Koushiki Pachinko Simulation for WonderSwan
description:
The Sankyo Fever series' sole WonderSwan entry.

Fever Sankyo Koushiki Pachinko Simulation for WonderSwan is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Bec, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Final Lap 2000
description: Final Lap 2000 is a Racing game, developed by Soft Machine and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Fire Pro Wrestling for WonderSwan
description: The greatest pro wrestling simulator is now on Wonderswan, allowing you to bring the action with you anywhere you go. Involve yourself in MASTER OF RING, the new management mode taking you through the ranks of wrestling, and create a wrestling legend with the edit mode.

title: Fishing Freaks: BassRise for WonderSwan
description: Fishing Freaks: BassRise for WonderSwan is a Sports game, developed by Bandai and published by Bec, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: From the TV Animation:One Piece ~Mezase Kaizokuou!~
description: From TV Animation: One Piece is an Adventure game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Ganso JaJaMaru-kun
description: Ganso JaJaMaru-kun (元祖じゃじゃ丸くん?) is a remake of the video game Ninja JaJaMaru-kun released in Japan on April 15, 1999 by Jaleco for the WonderSwan. It is an enhanced version of the original Famicom game with better control, though it uses monochrome graphics due to being an original WonderSwan game

title: Glocal Hexcite
description: Glocal Hexcite is a Puzzle game, developed by Gu Inc and published by Success, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Gomokunarabe & Reversi: Touryuumon
description: Gomokunarabe & Reversi: Touryuumon is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Sammy Studios, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Goraku Ou Tango!
description: Goraku Ou Tango! is a Puzzle game, published by Mebius, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Graduation for Wonderswan
alternate_titles: 卒業 for WonderSwan | Sotsugyou for WonderSwan
description: The player will become a new teacher who has just been assigned to a private Seika Gakuen, and will take care of the five problem children (Seimi Arai, Minatsu Kato, Mami Shimura, Reiko Takashiro, Shizuka Nakamoto) of the 3rd grade B group in charge. I will lead you to the path. All of them are unique. There are pros and cons, but let's teach with love so that everyone can graduate safely and happily. There is also a mini game.

title: Gunpey
description: Gunpey is a Puzzle game, developed by Koto and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Hanafuda Shiyouyo
description: Hanafuda Shiyouyo is a Miscellaneous game, published by Success, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Harobots
alternate_titles: ～ハロボッツ～
description: A training game for "Haro" that appeared in Mobile Suit Gundam. On the planet Atius, the battle by Robopet's "Halo" is very popular. The player raises this Harobots and aims to become the strongest Harobots Butler. By playing 4 types of mini-games, Haro's ability will gradually increase. When the basic ability has risen to some extent, combine attributes and obtain new robot data. The obtained robot data can be used as Halo's transformation ability during battle. What's more, the robot data is the data of famous Sunrise robots such as Dunbine and Zambot 3, so I'm surprised! Of course, you can also exchange data and play against each other!

title: Hunter X Hunter: Ishi o Tsugomono
description: Hunter X Hunter is a Role-Playing game, developed by Access and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Kakutou Ryouri Densetsu Bistro Recipe: Wonder Battle Hen
description: Bistro Recipe is a Strategy game, developed and published by Banpresto, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Kaze no Klonoa: Moonlight Museum
description: Klonoa and his friend Huepow come across a young crying girl who tells them that the moon has been divided into fragments and stolen by a mysterious group of artists that reside in the nearby Moonlight Museum. Determined to help, the duo rush off to the Museum's entrance, and once they come inside, they are greeted by a painter named Picoo who traps them inside a piece of artwork. Klonoa and Huepow must fight their way through five worlds within the Museum itself before finding the source of all their troubles and restoring the moon to the sky.

title: Keiba Yosou Shien Soft: Yosou Shin Karon
alternate_titles: 競馬予想支援ソフト 予想進化論
description: Horse racing prediction software that allows you to enter data on racehorses with a simple operation. Since it is possible to assemble the logic of ability evaluation independently, you can create your own prediction theory as if you were playing a game. Moreover, it may be possible to come up with the strongest theory because it can be improved based on experience. Also equipped with sample logic for those who do not have difficult expertise. As a luxury privilege, a "pocket horse racing data book" that is useful in actual battles is also included. It will be immediately useful as mobile phone prediction software.

title: KISS Yori... Seaside Serenade
description: KISS Yori... Seaside Serenade is an Adventure game, developed and published by Kid, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Kosodate Quiz Dokodemo: My Angel
description: Kosodate Quiz Dokodemo: My Angel is a Miscellaneous game, developed by Namco and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Kyousouba Ikusei Simulation: Keiba
description: Keiba is a Sports game, published by Bec, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Langrisser Millennium WS: The Last Century
description: Langrisser Millennium WS: The Last Century is a Strategy game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Last Stand
description: Last Stand is a Strategy game, developed by Soft Machine and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Lode Runner for WonderSwan
description: Lode Runner for WonderSwan is an Action game, developed by Aisystem Tokyo and published by Banpresto, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Macross: True Love Song
description: Macross: True Love Song is a Strategy game, developed and published by Lay-Up, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Magical Drop for WonderSwan
description: Magical Drop for WonderSwan is a Puzzle game, developed by Gaibrain and published by Data East, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Mahjong: Touryuumon
description: Mahjong Touryuumon is a Miscellaneous game, developed by Chat Noir and published by Sammy Studios, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Makaimura for WonderSwan
description:
Makaimura for WonderSwan (Japanese: 魔界村?, "Demon World Village for WonderSwan") is a game for the WonderSwan developed by Capcom and published by Bandai in 1999 and is part of the Ghosts 'n Goblins franchise.

Sharing similar gameplay to its predecessors, Makaimura also shares enemies, weapons and backgrounds from the previous three games. Unique features include double paths from the second till the fifth levels, swimming in water and a level which requires the player to rotate the wonderswan by 90 degrees as Arthur climbs and swings down a rope in a vertical shaft. Unlike other games, the player is not required to repeat the game after the penultimate level in order to get the one weapon to defeat the final boss Azrael.

title: Medarot: Perfect Edition - Kabuto Version
alternate_titles: メダロット・パーフェクトエディション(カブトムシバージョン)
description: An RPG set in the near future, where "robot battles (commonly known as robin)", in which robot pets and Medabots fight each other, are booming. Medabots consists of six parts: a tinpet corresponding to the skeleton, a medal corresponding to the brain, a head, a right arm, a left arm, and a leg, and there are 60 types of parts for each. By rearranging these parts, you can make your own Medabots. If you beat the enemy with Robottle, you can steal the opponent's parts, and you can also get the parts at the event. If you connect to your friend's Medabots with a communication cable, you can play against your friend's Medabots or exchange parts.

title: Medarot: Perfect Edition - Kuwagata Version
alternate_titles: メダロット・パーフェクトエディション(クワガタバージョン)
description: An RPG set in the near future, where "robot battles (commonly known as robin)", in which robot pets and Medabots fight each other, are booming. Medabots consists of six parts: a tinpet corresponding to the skeleton, a medal corresponding to the brain, a head, a right arm, a left arm, and a leg, and there are 60 types of parts for each. By rearranging these parts, you can make your own Medabots. If you beat the enemy with Robottle, you can steal the opponent's parts, and you can also get the parts at the event. If you connect to your friend's Medabots with a communication cable, you can play against your friend's Medabots or exchange parts.

title: Meitantei Conan: Majutsushi no Chousenjou!
description: Meitantei Conan is an Adventure game, developed by Tomcat System and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Meitantei Conan: Nishi no Meitantei Saidai no Kiki!?
description: Meitantei Conan: Nishi no Meitantei Saidai no Kiki!? is an Adventure game, developed by Tomcat System and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Meta Communication Therapy: Nee Kiite!
alternate_titles: メタコミセラピー「ねぇ聞いて!」
description: Healing character "Yuyu" that keeps moving with non-stop animation. A game that heals the player's own mind while communicating with such "Yuyu". You can talk to "Yuyu" about your love affairs, have a psychological test, and sometimes talk to "Yuyu" based on the information you got from your friends. , A new dimension communication tool that solves your worries before you know it. Let the healing character "Yuyu" heal your heart.

title: Mingle Magnet
description:
Mingle Magnet is a simple puzzle game of the falling block variety. The player oversees a 10 x 10 square field where the first four rows (three on easy) have been filled by blocks. Each block shows one of three symbols, a dark gray circle, a light gray circle, and a white circle. When ever any of blocks with matching symbols touch they will form a link. By moving the cursor over a chain and clicking on it the player will be given points based on its size on the chain will be removed. The goal is to get a large score while making sure that new pieces can still enter the field. Once no more pieces can enter the game ends. Blocks fall at the same time one square apart, when the next set of blocks fall they will occupy the space given by the previous drop.

The "magnet" aspect of Mingle Magnet come into play in how the player can control the placement of the blocks. All the blocks are attracted to a magnet which, although not seen, can be placed on any side of the field. All blocks will be drawn to the magnet. For example, if one has the magnet at the south of the field and then puts it to the north what was the top of the block pile will now be the bottom, and blocks will fall onto what was the bottom. The direction of the magnet is indicated by a magnetic field animation behind the action.

This game is played vertically.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam MSVS
description: A simulation game. Players assume the role of an Anaheim Electronics test pilot as they utilize various Mobile Suits from Gundam's One Year War era.

title: Moero!! Pro Yakyuu Rookies
description: Moero!! Pro Yakyuu Rookies is a Sports game, developed by TOSE and published by Jaleco Entertainment, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Morita Shogi for WonderSwan
description: Morita Shogi for WonderSwan is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Yuki, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Nazo-Oh Pocket
description: Nazo-Oh Pocket is an Adventure game, developed by Bandai Visual and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: Shito Ikusei
description: Neon Genesis Evangelion is a Role-Playing game, developed by Soft Machine and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Nice On
description: Nice On is a Sports game, developed by Aisystem Tokyo and published by Sammy Studios, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Nippon Pro Mahjong Renmei Kounin: Tetsuman
description: Tetsuman is a Miscellaneous game, developed by Chat Noir and published by Kaga Tech, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Nobunaga no Yabou for Wonderswan
alternate_titles: 信長の野望 for WonderSwan | Nobunaga's Ambition for WonderSwan
description: The popular series "Nobunaga's Ambition" has been renewed for WonderSwan! Enjoy the battle of the Sengoku daimyo who bet his life on the trade-in with new features such as heirloom exchange and war battle! !! Now is the time to become a turbulent Sengoku daimyo and aim to unify the world! Take command of the warlords under your control and get all 16 countries. In a breathtaking battle, you are the one who will fulfill your dream of unity. A new history is about to begin. Equipped with a new heirloom exchange system. Realize online battle play. There are more than 100 warlords. You can save 3 places.

title: Ochan no Oekaki Logic
description: Ochan no Oekaki Logic is a Puzzle game, developed by Santaclaus and published by SunSoft, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Pocket Fighter
description: It's the most outrageous fighting game ever! Innocent but deadly, these pint-sized champions from Street Fighter and DarkStalkers pack one heck of a punch. Battle to collect power-up gems and duke it out with the most insane attacks and hilarious fighting combos of all time.

title: Pro Mahjong Kiwame for WonderSwan
description: Pro Mahjong Kiwame for WonderSwan is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Athena, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Puyo Puyo Tsuu
alternate_titles: ぷよぷよ通
description: Competitive falling object puzzle game. "Puyo Puyo alone" mode where you can beat the monsters nesting in the tower of magic, "Puyo Puyo" mode where you can brute force against all characters, "Tokon" mode where the level goes up every time you win, battle cable Equipped with 4 modes of "competition play" mode using. Enjoy "Puyo Puyo" anytime, anywhere.

title: Puzzle Bobble
description: Puzzle Bobble is a Puzzle game, developed by Yoshidayama Workshop and published by SunSoft, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Rainbow Islands: Putty's Party
description: Rainbow Islands: Putty's Party is an Action game, developed by DigitalWare and published by MegaHouse, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Ring: Infinity
description: Ring: Infinity (リング ∞) is a visual novel game for the WonderSwan released only in Japan in 2000. The game begins much like the other stories in the "Ring" series do by introducing you to the "Cursed Videotape." From there, you must find a way to save yourself, or perish.

title: Robot Works
description: Robot Works is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Rock Man & Forte: Challenger from the Future
alternate_titles: ロックマン&フォルテ 未来からの挑戦者 | Rockman & Forte - Mirai Kara no Chousensha
description: Join Rock Man and Forte's fight for humankind as you face off with the newest menace in town--Robot King. King's captured all of the data plans for Dr. Wily's creations. They will equip King with all the knowledge he needs to build his own indestructible army of robots. As either Rock Man or Forte, you'll set out separate adventures using a variety of battle moves and weapons to defeat robot masters. Hidden bolts and CDs give you extra items to assist in battles.

title: Rockman & Forte
alternate_titles: Megaman & Bass
description: Rokkuman ando Forute: Mirai kara no Chousensha, lit. "Rockman & Forte: Challenger from the Future") is a video game in the classic Rockman series. It is considered to be a “sequel” to Rockman & Forte due to its naming, though it actually continues on from the story of Rockman World 2. It was developed by Bandai under license by Capcom and released on August 5, 1999 for the Bandai WonderSwan

title: Sangokushi for Wonderswan
alternate_titles: 三國志II for WonderSwan | Romance of the Three Kingdoms for WonderSwan
description: WS completely original. Time is China in the Three Kingdoms era. There were men who gave their lives to me on the vast continent. Liu Bei, Cao Cao, Komei, Lu Bu, Chisho and Takeshi ... each collide in a hot battle. A maximum of 5 cities will be battlefields, and the battle will change depending on the combination of cities that will be battlefields. More than 200 warlords who appear have their own special skills, and the battle situation changes depending on their actions. The aim is to unify all 19 states. Can you master the warlords and claim victory all over China?

title: Sangokushi II for Wonderswan
alternate_titles: 三國志II for WonderSwan | Romance of the Three Kingdoms II for WonderSwan
description: The number of military commanders appearing has also been greatly increased from about 200 in the previous work to about 350. Strategies are becoming more diverse due to abundant strategies such as "Ambush Poison", "Dragon Tiger Wolf", and "Two Tiger Competition". In addition, as an original specification only for the WS version, it is equipped with a function called "Bushou Retsuden" that allows you to see the profiles of the warlords at a glance! If you use this function, you can use this software as a portable "Sangokushi database".

title: SD Gundam Eiyuuden: Kishi Densetsu
description: SD Gundam Eiyuuden: Kishi Densetsu is a Racing game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2001.

title: SD Gundam G Generation: Gather Beat
description: SD Gundam G Generation: Gather Beat is a Strategy game, developed by Vanguard Works and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: SD Gundam: Emotional Jam
description: SD Gundam: Emotional Jam is a Strategy game, developed by Tom Create and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: SD Gundam: Gashapon Senki Episode 1
description: SD Gundam: Gashapon Senki Episode 1 is a Strategy game, developed by Graphic Research and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Senkaiden: TV Animation Senkaiden Houshin Engi Yori
description: Senkaiden is a Role-Playing game, developed by Graphic Research and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Sennou Millennium
description: Sennou Millennium is a Puzzle game, developed by Kouyousha and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Shanghai Pocket
description: Shanghai Pocket is a Puzzle game, developed and published by SunSoft, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Shin Nippon Pro Wrestling: Toukon Retsuden
alternate_titles: 新日本プロレスリング 闘魂烈伝 | New Japan Wrestling Fighting Spirit Retsuden
description: A professional wrestling game in which players belonging to Japan's hottest professional wrestling organization "New Japan Pro-Wrestling" appear under their real names. Six wrestlers can be used during the game: Shinya Hashimoto, Masahiro Chono, Keiji Mutoh, Kensuke Sasaki, Hiroyoshi Tenzan, and Jushin Thunder Liger. These six representatives of New Japan Pro-Wrestling will fight by making full use of techniques such as Kenka Kick, Dragon Screw, and DDT. You are the one who decides the strongest wrestler in New Japan Pro-Wrestling!

title: Shogi: Touryuumon
description: Shogi Touryuumon is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Sammy Studios, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Side Pocket for WonderSwan
description: Side Pocket for WonderSwan is a Sports game, developed and published by Data East, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Slither Link
description: Slither Link is a Puzzle game, developed by Tomcat System and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

title: Soccer Yarou!: Challenge The World

title: Space Invaders
alternate_titles: スペースインベーダー
description: Attention all Earthlings! Relentless alien hordes have been identified near you. Prevent the dangerous Space Invaders from landing on your territory. Use your cannon to defend against waves of descending alien invaders. Don't let them hit the ground or it's all over for you and the Earth! Destroy them and score points!

title: Super Robot Taisen Compact
description: Super Robot Taisen Compact is a Strategy game, developed by TOSE and published by Banpresto, which was released in Japan in 1999.

title: Super Robot Taisen Compact 2 Dai-1-Bu: Chijou Gekidou-hen
alternate_titles: スーパーロボット大戦COMPACT 2 第1部:地上激動篇
description: The second installment of "Super Robot Wars COMPACT" is the largest scale, consisting of all three parts, "Ground turbulence", "Space tremor", and "Galaxy decisive battle". The WS built-in memory is used for the transition from Part 1 to Part 2, and the "flag conversion system" is adopted in which the actions in Part 1 are taken over at the same time and the story in Part 2 changes. There is. In addition, Combatler V and Zambot 3 that did not appear in the previous work appeared, and Hiei and Dangaio also participated. Full of other cut-in systems. In addition, an original unit for the main character will also appear.

title: Super Robot Taisen Compact 2 Dai-2-Bu: Uchuu Gekishin-hen
alternate_titles: スーパーロボット大戦COMPACT 2 第2部:宇宙激震篇
description: The stage moves from the ground of the previous work to space. The mystery left in the ground edition is solved, and a new mystery is thrown into the third part, which is the final edition. The robots that appeared in "UFO Robo Glendizer", "Gundam ZZ", and "Gundam F91" are newly participating in "Space Earthquake". In addition, the robots from "Machine Robo: Revenge of the Chronos", which will be the first appearance in the Super Robot Wars series, will also appear. The cut-in system has been further improved in quality, and new graphics have been added.

title: Tekken Card Challenge
description: Fighting games are generally interested in making a player hit a complex mash of buttons to perform pugilistic wonders. This game is however card based, how can that work? During a battle between two opponents a set of five moves will appear on a roulette. The player hits a button to stop the rotation of the selector to semi-randomly select a field. A higher number card will always cancels out a lower number card. Higher number cards also do more damage. Block cards and counter cards also exist.

alternate_titles: トランプコレクション 2 ボトムアップ的世界一周の旅
description: This time, 4 types of "Speed", "Nervous weakness", "7 rows" and "Dobon" are recorded. The "item collection system" that was popular in the previous work is still alive. In addition to the "normal mode" where you can enjoy the game normally, the "round the world mode" where you can get items while traveling around the world is added.

title: Wonder Stadium
alternate_titles: ワンダースタジアム
description: Standard software for baseball games. With the advanced screen display function of WS, 1st to 3rd bases are displayed on one screen for the first time in the series. This makes it easier to defend, and also improves the sense of presence such as stealing bases! There are 14 teams appearing. There are two modes: "Tokon Baseball" where you can enjoy open games, pennant races, and all-star games, and "Tokon Nurturing" where you can fight pennant races with the original team. Of course, 2P battles using communication cables are also possible. In addition, it is packed with a variety of functions such as "home run competition" and "scorebook" that allows you to check recorded data.

title: WonderWitch
alternate_titles: ワンダーウィッチ
description:
The WonderWitch is a commercial development kit for the WonderSwan. The kit allowed any person able to develop software in the developing language C, to create software for the WonderSwan. It was supported throughout the  lifespan of the WonderSwan and was updated multiple time, including a major update on December 24, 2000 to add support for the WonderSwan Color and added support for Windows XP on October 29, 2001.

The WonderWitch was not for everybody as good programming skills were required to be able to use it. The development kit was also expensive considering that the consoles were sold to half the price of the WonderWitch. Even without being a huge success, the WonderWitch was able to gather a very active community of WonderSwan developers which gave the idea to Bandai and Qute to create a programming contest.

title: Wuz up b? Produce: Street Dancer
alternate_titles: Wuz↑B Produce - Street Dancer | wuz↑b?(ワサビ)プロデュース ストリートダンサー
description:
Wuz ↑ b? (Wasabi) Is a popular dance group of three women. This "Street Dancer with Wasabi" is a tie-in with "wuz ↑ b?".

The rules are very simple, just press the button according to the instructions on the timing bar, but there are 3 types of music genres in total, JAZZ, HIPHOP, Lock'In, and HIPHOP is a horizontal screen, Lock'In. The vertical screen and JAZZ have an upside-down screen, and the style changes depending on the song, making it an action game that involuntarily heats up. Players can choose between Nana, Kaoru, Shino or the mysterious genius dancer "U" as a player character. The characters of "wuz ↑ b?" And others are made with reference to their own opinions, from the design to the choreography of the dance.
